DOC.brief_summary: Background : According International Association Study Pain ( IASP ) , term temporomandibular disorder ( TMD ) regard subgroup orofacial pain , symptom include pain discomfort temporomandibular joint , ear , masticatory muscle neck one side well joint sound , limit mandibular movement mandibular deviation difficulty chew . Phototherapy , low level laser therapy ( LLLT ) light-emitting diode ( LED ) therapy , one resource use treatment muscle pain . Thus , need investigate therapeutic resource combine different wavelength well different light source ( LLLT LED ) apparatus . Question : The aim propose study evaluate effect phototherapy pain , activity masticatory muscle ( masseter anterior temporal bilaterally ) joint mobility individual temporomandibular disorder ( TMD ) . A aim determine cumulative effect 24 48 hour six session . Methods/Design : A placebo-controlled , double-blind , randomize , clinical trial carry involve 30 woman 18 40 year age diagnosis myogenous TMD . The participant randomly allocate two group total 15 individual per group . Group 1 submit session phototherapy 39,27 Joules per point one group receive placebo therapy ( 0 Joules ) . The following assessment tool administer four separate occasion ( baseline immediately , 24 h 48 h phototherapy ) . Pain intensity assess use visual analog scale pain , meter range movement , electromyographic EMG analysis masseter anterior temporal muscle . Discussion : The study support practice evidence-based use phototherapy individual myogenous TMD . Data publish study complete .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Phototherapy Individuals With Temporomandibular Disorder
DOC.criteria: All volunteer diagnosis myogenous TMD base RDC/TMD moderate severe pain masseter temporal muscle rat expert dentist . To standardize sample , body mass index participant must less 25 kg/m2 , amount adipose tissue electrode surface muscle affect reading electromyographic ( EMG ) signal . All volunteer must also initial pain score great 3 point VAS . The exclusion criterion miss teeth , use denture , systemic neuromuscular disease , history trauma face temporomandibular joint , history temporomandibular joint luxation , currently undergo orthodontic treatment , currently undergo medicinal treatment affect musculoskeletal system ( analgesic , antiinflammatory agent muscle relaxant ) .
